WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) view external returns (struct Structs.Block memory)
function (uint256,uint256,uint256) view external returns (struct Structs.Vote memory)

params.epochs: The difference of epochs where the staker was inactive
params.stakeValue: The Stake that staker had in last epoch

returns._0: The number of stakers in the razor network

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

params.epoch: the epoch value todo reduce complexity
params.stakerId: The id of staker currently in consideration

params.epoch: The epoch number for which reveal has been called

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._blockManagerAddress: The address of the BlockManager contract
params._schAddress: The address of the Schelling token ERC20 contract
params._stateManagerAddress: The address of the StateManager contract todo disable after init
params._voteManagerAddress: The address of the VoteManager contract

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._epochLastRevealed: The number of epoch that staker revealed asset values

params.bountyHunter: The address of the bounty hunter
params.id: The ID of the staker who is penalised

params.amount: The amount of schelling tokens Staker stakes
params.epoch: The Epoch value for which staker is requesting to stake
The Epoch value for which staker is requesting to unstake
The Epoch value for which staker is requesting a withdraw

calculateInactivityPenalties(uint256,uin.notice: Calculates the inactivity penalties of the staker

giveBlockReward(uint256,uint256).notice: The function gives block reward for one valid proposer in the previous epoch by minting new tokens from the schelling token contract called from confirmBlock function of BlockManager contract

givePenalties(uint256,uint256).notice: gives penalty to stakers for failing to reveal or reveal value deviations

giveRewards(uint256,uint256).notice: This function is called in VoteManager reveal function to give rewards to all the stakers who have correctly staked, committed, revealed the Values of assets according to the razor protocol rules.

slash(uint256,address,uint256).notice: The function is used by the Votemanager reveal function to penalise the staker who lost his secret and make his stake zero and transfer to bounty hunter half the schelling tokens of the stakers stake

stake(uint256,uint256).notice: stake during commit state only we check epoch during every transaction to avoid withholding and rebroadcasting attacks

unstake(uint256).notice: staker must call unstake() and continue voting for Constants.WITHDRAW_LOCK_PERIOD after which she can call withdraw() to finally Withdraw

withdraw(uint256).notice: Helps stakers withdraw their stake if previously unstaked

userdoc.notice: StakeManager handles stake, unstake, withdraw, reward, functions for stakers
